Embraer Legacy 450/500 and Praetor 500/600 MENUS AND DISPLAYS Pro Line Fusion® Avionics HSI Format

Figure 5-26 HUD – Heading/Navigation Indicators

The HSI has 3 states of operation:

• CDI indications with overlays.

• FMS map indications with overlays.

• Clean HSI: All overlays removed.

The Horizontal Situation Indicator (HSI) format on the DU is a compass rose that shows heading, course, and track information. The HSI provides lubber line heading, a heading readout, selected heading bug, compass reference marks, course pointer, lateral deviation bar, scale, and to/from arrow. Pilot and copilot-side bearing pointers are available for display. A white aircraft symbol is shown in the center of the HSI. Weather Radar, Lightning, and TCAS Trafﬁc overlays can be shown on the HSI display. The DCP HSI button toggles between these three states. The clean HSI quickly removes all the overlays to

provide a clean presentation of just the navigation indications. FMS map indications are available when FMS is the navigation source on the HSI, they are not available when VOR/LOC is the navigation source.

The HUD shows a simpliﬁed version of the HSI with many of the same heading and navigation indications.

SELECTIONS:

NAV Source Data Block

The NAV source data block displays information relative to the active NAV source. Each side of the cockpit may independently select a NAV source. The NAV source data block indicates the selected NAV source, the next FMS waypoint or NAVAID frequency or ID, the course desire/track readout, Time To Go (TTG) to the waypoint or NAVAID, and distance to the waypoint or NAVAID.

• The NAV source is selected with controls in the NAV Source Dialog Box on the PFD Task Menu or via the FMS and V/L buttons on the DCP. The selected NAV source drives the on-side navigation displays. The NAV source data block is shown in the upper left corner of the HSI format. The NAV source color is:

• Green for a VOR/LOC on-side NAV source

• Magenta for FMS on-side NAV source or third FMS

• Yellow for a cross-side NAV source.

• The ID line automatically changes to show the waypoint name, NAVAID frequency, or NAVAID ID based on the currently selected NAV source.
